relevant_findings.physical_examination: The proband demonstrated frankly elevated serum PTH levels, low calcium to creatinine clearance ratio indicative of FHH.
relevant_findings.imaging: Kidney ultrasound showed no signs of kidney stones or nephrocalcinosis; imaging techniques did not show enlarged parathyroid glands.

relevant_findings.newborn: The infant presented with mildly elevated calcium and markedly elevated PTH levels. Initialization of vitamin D supplementation at 600 IU/d.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum PTH levels decreased and normalized by day 70 after birth; serum calcium rose slightly to a moderately elevated steady-state level.
